name: The Mercer

reviews.text: Had a short, but excellent, stay at the Mercer. Was upgraded at check-in to a suite, which shared the floor with only 1 other room.
reviews.title: Well appointed new hotel in terrific location

reviews.text: Location is perfect - can walk or subway everywhere in a short distance as the hotel is right on the Sheung Wan MTR. Hollywood Rd is a 10 minute walk.
reviews.title: Excellent Service, Made Hong Kong the best ever!

reviews.text: Rooms are very well appointed, with free minibars, good lighting and plenty of electrical outlets. Free wifi worked very well.
reviews.title: Excellent location, comfortable hote

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note that the gym is very small. Also, do not expect to nap or sleep during the day - nearby construction is very, very loud.
reviews.title: Excellent stay in Mercer

reviews.text: This hotel was absolutely amazing. As soon as we arrived everyone at the hotel was very kind and considerate. We had a large group of 12 people, and were able to book 4 rooms with 3 people in each room. Not only were the regular beds amazing, but even the cots were fluffy and beautiful. Every night was like sleeping on a cloud, and made getting up and seeing the city that much easier. We really didnt want to leave. The breakfast was also completely amazing. Every morning we ate so much fruit and scrambled eggs, and saved ourselves money when we were so full we didn't need any food till supper time. The Mercer was in an amazing location, and we really couldn't have asked for anything better.
reviews.title: Good value, good location

reviews.text: This new boutique hotel is an excellent choice. Close to Central; Soho and Lan Kwai Fong - all within easy walking distance. Nice rooms, rather spacious for Hong Kong standards and with Nespresso machines.
reviews.title: Nice hotel option in HK

reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights during a business trip the staff were extremely friendy rooms very clean with little luxuries awaiting you in the bathroom. Central location will definately stay again on my next visit to Hong Kong
reviews.title: Well Recommended

reviews.text: We chose this boutique hotel in HK for something a bit different, having been to HK on 5 previous times.
reviews.title: Mercer hotel HK

reviews.text: Location is close to shopping, although we have found Wan Chai more interesting for its shopping.
reviews.title: Certainly a Good Hotel to stay

reviews.text: We stayed in a suite on L27. The room is split into two parts, but for a suite overall it was average. Room was quiet, but the air conditioning was very noisy and the fan couldn't be turned down.
reviews.title: Short but sweet

reviews.text: Was doubtful of my choice when the taxi driver from the airport had no idea where the hotel was.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: However, although the entrance was small the greeting from staff was very re-assuring. I found my upgraded room to a studio apartment was fantastic and everything from there on was wonderful. Location, at first, a little worrying for a woman travelling solo but my fears were groundless. All in all I had a wonderful time and would look to stay here again.
reviews.title: Convenient great location stylish hotel

reviews.text: This is the 4th time in 16 months that we stayed at the mercer hotel . Once again we enjoyed the convenience of the location and the comfortable rooms. We love the Nespresso Machine and the breakfasts have improved .
reviews.title: Boutique but comfortable

reviews.text: This is a small interesting hotel in a (becoming) trendy part of Hong Kong. Central to all the sights and amenities, the Hotel is well situated. The room is very comfortable and there was little or no street noise. OK breakfast and friendly staff. My room was large with two flat screen tvs. No real view to speak of but you would need to stay elsewhere if this is what you are after. The room is decorated in a style whi8ch is very similiar to the Hospes Group in Spain.
reviews.title: Great Boutiqe Hotel

reviews.text: Recommended
reviews.title: In the heart of Hong Kong

reviews.text: I stayed for three nights on business and like others was upgraded on arrival to a suite on 28th floor which had the benefit of being quiet. The room had everything I needed, a mini-kitchen and dining area, a separate TV in the living area as well as one in the bedroom - all facilities would be fantastic for a couple / family who may need extra space. The staff were helpful (I left my passport behind during check-in and the staff contacted me straight away and sent my passport to my room). The room was cleaning exceptionally well every day. Free mini bar and wifi was a real bonus as was the availability of a 24 gym. The breakfast room is small and can get crowded when everyone comes down at once. The menu for breakfast is quite limited and more towards western food instead of HK food (recommend to have more dimsum as one of HK cuisine). Hotel is very well located, very close to the business district, shops, MTR station (sheung wan) and also the soho area with lots of bars and restaurants. I recommend this place highly and will definitely stay here again for business trips (quite expensive for personal trip though).
reviews.title: Great hotel for business trip

reviews.text: I stayed for six nights on business and like others was upgraded on arrival to a suite on the top floor which had the benefit of being quiet, and although you can't see the harbour, the view is still impressive. The room had everything I needed (and more), a mini-kitchen and dining area, a separate TV in the living area as well as one in the bedroom - all facilities would be fantastic for a couple / family who may need extra space. The staff were extremely helpful, and the room was cleaning exceptionally well every day. Free mini bar and wifi was a real bonus as was the availability of a 24 gym. The breakfast room is small and can get crowded when everyone comes down at once, but as I tended to be early there was very little problem for me. Hotel is very well located, very close to the business district, shops, MTR station and also the soho area with lots of bars and restaurants. I really cannot recommend this place highly enough and will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Decided to stay in a boutique hotel on the Island and were not disappointed with our decision to stay at the Mercer. Staff were courteous and helpful. We liked all the quirky features throughout our apartment on level 31, but not the glass door on the bathroom!
reviews.title: Sojourn in HK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is exceptionally well located to the mid level restaurants and bars and Central.
reviews.title: Very good experience over 2 nights...
Good location, pricy
reviews.text: Would not hesitate to stay here again.

description: The Mercer delivers contemporary luxury and comfort with large spacious rooms in the fashionable up and coming Sheung Wan area. The new boutique hotel is only 1 minute from Sheung Wan MTR station, and within easy walking distance of Central’s prime business, shopping and dining locations.
